ReturnVehicleTime: Return of the Vehicle in the Agreed Time
tenant1: The renter is responsible for any damage, scratches or defects suffered by the vehicle during the rental period. If the car is returned in a condition other than that received, the renter must cover the costs of repair or replacement, as appropriate.
tenant2: Any traffic fines or violations obtained during the use of the vehicle are the responsibility of the renter. The lessor (owner) may retain part of the deposit or charge the corresponding costs to cover these fines.
tenant3: The vehicle must be returned on the date and time stated. In the event of a delay, an additional charge will be applied for each extra hour. If the delay exceeds a specified period without prior notice, it will be considered a breach of contract.
tenant4: In the event of loss or theft of the vehicle, the lessee must cover the costs of recovery or replacement of the vehicle. In addition, the lessee must notify the lessor immediately and cooperate with the authorities in the investigation process.
tenant5: The renter agrees to use the vehicle responsibly and only for legal purposes. Use in competitions, off-road or in activities that may put the vehicle's integrity at risk is prohibited.
LiabilityTheft: Liability in Case of Damage or Theft
owner1: The lessor declares that he is the legal owner of the vehicle and has full right to rent it. He agrees to provide legal documentation for the vehicle and to comply with any necessary inspections prior to rental.
owner2: The lessor ensures that the vehicle is in optimal condition for general use. Any damage or mechanical failure prior to rental must be declared and documented.
owner3: The lessor must indicate whether the vehicle has full or partial coverage insurance. Any incident that occurs during the rental and is not covered by the insurance will be the responsibility of the lessee.
owner4: In the event of damage or theft, the landlord reserves the right to demand compensation from the tenant, depending on the magnitude of the incident, whether for theft or damage.
owner5: The lessor reserves the right to inspect the vehicle at the end of the rental period. Any unreported damage observed after the rental may result in an additional charge to the lessee.
contract1: The tenant will rent the vehicle for a period of
contract2: The total amount agreed for the rental of the vehicle is
contract4: The tenant agrees to make proper use of the vehicle and to respect all traffic regulations. The tenant is responsible for any damage that occurs to the vehicle during the rental period.
contract5: The owner guarantees that the vehicle is in optimal condition for use and undertakes to deliver the vehicle with sufficient fuel for the start of the rental.
contract6: The vehicle will be delivered to the specified location, and the tenant must return it in the same condition in which it was delivered, except for normal wear and tear.

paragraph8: while the tenant can be contacted by phone
introCuriosity: Curious to know how this amazing web app works? It's very accessible. What do you want to be? Someone who rents out their vehicles (Owner) or someone who wants to own a vehicle (Tenant)?
tenantStep1: Find the car of your dreams in the 'Vehicle Search' section.
tenantStep2: Once you find the ideal vehicle, select 'Request' to fill out the form and send your request to the car owner.
tenantStep3: Check the 'Applications' section to see if your application was accepted or rejected.
tenantStep4: Once your application is accepted, you can pay in the 'Applications' section.
tenantStep5: After payment, the contract will appear in the 'Requests' section.
tenantStep6: Done! Now you can pick up the vehicle and enjoy your trip.
ownerStep1: Add a vehicle in the 'My Vehicles' section.
ownerStep2: Check 'Notifications' to see if anyone has requested your vehicle.
ownerStep3: Review the request. If you agree, accept it. If not, reject it.
ownerStep4: When the tenant pays, you will be able to see the contract between the two of you.
ownerStep5: The renter will pick up the vehicle and your car will be protected by the contract.
dualRoleMessage: You can also be both Owner and Tenant. Everything is within your reach!
notFound1: Oh no, it seems we've lost our way...
notFound2: The page you are looking for cannot be found. It may have been moved or deleted.
notFound3: But don't worry, you can return to the main page by clicking on Speedy Rent!
